We stayed here while visiting family and it is definitely a convenient location but overall I was not very impressed with this Airbnb.
Upon arriving to the unit we were immediately greeted with a LOT of dust. The light over the door, the tv, the kitchen surfaces, and most noticeably, the thick layer on the air intake register for the air conditioner. It made the rest of the place feel unclean.
A studio should be full of useful ways to make the most of the space and outside of the Murphy bed, it certainly was not. There was an abundance of unnecessary fake plants on anything you could have used for storage and almost nowhere to put things in the bathroom while getting ready.
The bathroom sink was barely usable because of the placement of the faucet.
The furniture and pillows are cheap and uncomfortable but luckily the bed was fine.
They went for form over function on everything. Looks good/not functional.
We would stay again as it was convenient, but perhaps in a different room.

review_text:
You would think that one might expect more after a long 3 year wait since our last little vacation that 3 days of mostly rain, with a few peeks at the sun, humid days would be a disappointment. Far from it. This has been, by far, the most relaxing and peaceful and fun vacation we have had…ever! There were enough breaks in the rain for us to enjoy a few walks down the beautiful quiet trails with our Golden Retriever “Winter”. When the rain came down, we enjoyed listening to the rain on the roof and watching the leaves of the trees undulate in the breeze. The light show and rolling thunder from the night time storms were exciting and beautiful!
Now for this little cabin of Grampa’s… about all I can say is “perfection”. I am a vintage dealer, and I lean most towards the styles that bring me memories of my own growing up years. Oh the memories it stirred of my girlhood home in the 1950’s and 1960’s. !.. the pole lamp, the owl clock, the little Mid Century Rocker, the cabinet under the tv to mention just a few. The knotty pine paneling on the Porch room, the narrow board wood floors in the main part of the house and the wonderful midcentury cupboards in the kitchen. Don’t forget to pay attention to that amazing bathroom with the gray and black plastic tiles, the same tiles I remember from my own childhood home. The house / cabin is about the same size as our use, the same efficient use of space. You could raise 5 – 6 kids here… back in the day. It amazes me what people think is necessary these days. Here is the almost hidden treasure I want you all to notice… that chrome covered recessed toothbrush and soap holder in the bathroom right under the medicine cabinet. I had no idea what it was, but Gale is more inclined to test things out, so he pushed on it and there it was! Love it!!!
Thank you, Bruce and family, for the best mini vacation ever.
